description:
An array of data points for the series. For the mappoint series type, points can be given in the following ways:

  1. An array of numerical values. In this case, the numerical values will be interpreted as y options. The x values will be automatically calculated, either starting at 0 and incremented by 1, or from pointStart and pointInterval given in the series options. If the axis has categories, these will be used. Example:

    data: [0, 5, 3, 5]

  2. An array of arrays with 2 values. In this case, the values correspond to x,y. If the first value is a string, it is applied as the name of the point, and the x value is inferred.

        data: [
        [0, 1],
        [1, 8],
        [2, 7]
    ]

  3. An array of objects with named values. The following snippet shows only a few settings, see the complete options set below. If the total number of data points exceeds the series' turboThreshold, this option is not available.

        data: [{
        x: 1,
        y: 7,
        name: "Point2",
        color: "#00FF00"
    }, {
        x: 1,
        y: 4,
        name: "Point1",
        color: "#FF00FF"
    }]

children.name: color
children.description: Individual color for the point. By default the color is either used to denote the value, or pulled from the global colors array.

children.name: dataLabels
children.description: Individual data label for each point. The options are the same as the ones for plotOptions.series.dataLabels.

samples.name: Disable data labels for individual areas

children.name: drilldown
children.description: The id of a series in the drilldown.series array to use for a drilldown for this point.

children.name: id
children.description: An id for the point. This can be used after render time to get a pointer to the point object through chart.get().

children.name: lat
children.description: The latitude of the point. Must be combined with the lon option to work. Overrides x and y values.

children.name: lon
children.description: The longitude of the point. Must be combined with the lon option to work. Overrides x and y values.

children.name: name
children.description: The name of the point as shown in the legend, tooltip, dataLabel etc.

children.name: x
children.description: The x coordinate of the point in terms of the map path coordinates.

children.name: y
children.description: The x coordinate of the point in terms of the map path coordinates.
